job_title: Child Care Worker in Raritan, NJ
pros: Great staff. Great Environment and a nice collage
cons: I don't have anything bad to say about this place

review_title: Great place to get your foot in the door
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in East Brunswick, NJ
pros: Good pay and good people. Best part is you get time off when the school is closed! If you are really good, local companies will notice and offer jobs. It's a good place to start and get experience. Does offer 401k (and matches A LOT!!!)
cons: Can be chaotic at times. Program is growing and has some growing pains, but progressing. No benefits as you are forced to work part time.

review_title: Great collegial and inclusive faculty and campus!
job_title: Adjunct English Instructor in Branchburg, NJ
pros: I love working as an adjunct English instructor at RVCC --the dynamic and supportive faculty in the English department and the opportunities for support --both financial and pedagogical/professional development --from their Center for Teaching Learning and Scholarship (CTLS) are abundant and unheard of at other community colleges. The students are diverse, motivated first-generation college students from immigrant families and RVCC is also very welcoming to students who are neurodivergent or have learning disabilities. It's a pleasure to come teach here! Adjuncts are PAID for training and pedagogical retreats and there is a designated office with coffee, printers, and a place for meeting students in cubicles --never encountered this anywhere else!
cons:
The low pay that comes with the territory as an adjunct anywhere.

The rural campus is a bit far from home for me --but worth the commute.

Older classrooms and bad computer labs --but new ones are coming!

job_title: Health Information Specialist in Branchburg, NJ
pros: Collaborative Friendly Caring Flexible Environment
cons: Workplace could be more lively.

review_title: They make it easy to work for them!
pros: I have worked several semesters at RVCC and have no issues with my department, pay, HR, etc. They are all very organized and helpful.
cons: I teach later in the day so the copy room is closed, often the cafe is as well.

pros: The director is encouraging and supportive of all employees. I consistently felt inspired to learn new skills and improve what I had already learned. Workplace safety is never compromised, and all employees are set up for success.
cons: No cons to speak of.

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Branchburg, NJ
pros: Great work experience, and great team.
cons: No cons, its a good job in general.

pros: Job opportunities due to many Grants being offered at RVCC
cons: They are really pushing vaccination

pros: Excellent benefits and generous time off.
cons: Lack of advancement and low starting salaries compared to 4-year institutions or corporate work.

pros: Affordable, great professors, very supportive
cons: On line classes are a little confusing

pros: Good and communicative supervisor with responsive staff
cons: Low rate of compensation salary

review_title: Wonderful part time gig WFH environment
pros: Great team, flexible hours, kind management
cons: The pay is just alright

pros: Benefits, work from home due to COVID, easy no brain work
cons: Everything else, students, parents ,faculty complains like crazy

review_title: Dissatisfying overall but a few positives.
pros: The only pros are the days off throughout the year and the benefits are pretty good as well. That's about it for all the pros, unfortunately!!
cons: Senior level employees are either past their prime and need to hang it up or too young and too dumb to lead properly.  But if you brown nose enough you will last a long time.

job_title: Senior Help Desk Student Aide in Branchburg, NJ
pros: Amazing people to work with! My supervisor was always friendly, available, and willing to teach us anything we needed to help us improve our skills. The pay was pretty great as it was above minimum wage and there is room for growth and promotions if you worked hard and were seeking a career in this field.
cons: Working with other students of many different backgrounds can sometimes be the cause of some drama. Other than that, it's a great place to work! I'm unsure about benefits as I worked as a Student Aide and was part-time.

job_title: Assistant Coordinator of Workforce Development in High Bridge, NJ
pros: Everyone is nice and helpful here and its very easy to adjust. People overall are helpful in terms of answering questions.
cons: There is not lots of room for advancement. It seems they do not promote from within but instead hire for advancement positions from the outside.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Annandale, NJ
pros: Pay is good compared to other colleges in the area. Lots of autonomy as an instructor. Pay is on a union scale.
cons: Mostly adjuncts who drive in, teach, and go home. Adjuncts are limited to 9 credits a semester so the college won't have to pay them benefits. College depends too much on adjuncts, but give them say in the way the departments are run.

pros: The benefits are great the school is closed for inclement weather and you make up the time . The parking is usually good if you come early.
cons: Cafeterias expensive the pay is ok. Some departments have worse attitudes than others. I still love it.

pros:
- Very good and comfortable environment to work in
-Great hourly pay (better than Rutger's)
- Friendly staff and students
- Pick your own hours, including  a saturday session
cons: - not really a con, but it's one of the few classrooms that I've worked that doesn't play music during a session

review_title: Good Until they Let You Go
pros: Serious comm college with a real bent towards excellence in education.
cons: Employs adjuncts because they are cheap, and lays them off on a whim.  Trying to form a union to prevent the good-old-boy retention scheme, adjuncts are still treated like chattel.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
pros: Laid back environment, flexibility. competitive salaries
cons: Student Service offices are all short staffed.  Peak periods are extremely busy. No room to advance.  To move up you must move on.

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Branchburg, NJ
pros: The other people working there are amazing.  They are friendly and caring no matter what department you or they work in.
cons: No opportunity for advancement.  Pay is terrible, way below average for a position.

pros: Great flexibility of new curriculum
cons: Course schedule changed from nights to days so I wasn't able to keep this as a second job
